Package com.example.ss7g7.stars

Class Login

java.lang.Object
com.example.ss7g7.stars.Login
public class Login
extends java.lang.Object
The Login class is to log and authenticate users trying to access the StarsSystem
Since:
2020/10/15
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ong Rui Peng, Angelina

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Login​(StarsDB db)
    This is a constructor that requires a given instance of the singleton StarsDB to set its own private variable of the database with the initialized instance of the database

  • Constructor Details

    • Login

      Login​(StarsDB db)
      This is a constructor that requires a given instance of the singleton StarsDB to set its own private variable of the database with the initialized instance of the database
      Parameters:
      db - refers to the initialized instance of the database

  • Method Details

    • login

      Login.LOGIN_RESULT login()
      This method gets the user inputted credentials and authenticates the user against stored user credentials in the database.

      Once the user has been authenticated, user will be streamed into UserType.ADMIN or UserType.STUDENT

      Returns:
      UNSUCCESSFUL_LOGIN if authentication fails; SUCCESSFUL_LOGIN if authentication is successful.

    • getCurrentUser

      User getCurrentUser()
      This method returns the current user
      Returns:
      object user

    • getLoginCred

      void getLoginCred()
      This method retrieves user inputted credentials

    • authUser

      java.lang.String authUser​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> hmap)
      This method authenticates the user by cross checking the user credentials stored in the database
      Parameters:
      hmap - refers to the key value pairs retrieved from the database
      Returns:
      String privilege of user
